text: Germany, Japan, Vietnam and the US have reported cases in patients who didn't personally visit China, but contracted the virus from someone else who had visited Wuhan, China. These cases of human to human transmission are the most worrisone, according to the WHO. #coronavirus

domain.name: Entities [Entity Service]
domain.description: Entity Service top level domain, every item that is in Entity Service should be in this domain

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

entity.name: World Health Organization declares coronavirus outbreak a public health emergency
entity.description: During a press conference, the WHO's Director-General Dr Tedros declared the coronavirus as a public health emergency of international concern. The announcement is only the sixth time such an emergency has been declared. Speaking in Geneva, Tedros said the "greatest concern is the potential for the virus to spread to countries with weaker health systems and which are ill-prepared to deal with it." The pneumonia-like virus has infected more than 7,736 people and killed at least 170.
